intro: Sterculia ramosii, commonly known as the African mallow or wild mallow, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, and it is often found in moist, wooded areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
